intro: Rudbeckia angulata, commonly known as angular rudbeckia, is a perennial flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and vibrant yellow to orange ray flowers surrounded by dark褐色 disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough, angular texture, giving it its common name. Rudbeckia angulata is often found in prairies, open woods, and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soil.
